Posts.Content: Hi Moomy, I am on Accord which seems to be the preferred brand by the majority of people on this site.  Have now started on high strength glucosamine, omega3, collagen and chondrotin tablets so hoping that will help.  Also gone back to a Pilates class after a few years.   I have had a bone density scan which showed up something in my hip and have had MRI of hip and now awaiting results.  Will see what they say and whether they offer me anything. Thanks. Lin x
Posts.Title: Letrozole Side Effects and how to cope with them

Posts.Content: Hi, I have just joined up this morning as after lying awake for 3 hours over past few nights I decided that I should ask for help from the people that understand what I am experiencing. I was diagnosed early April 2018 and fortunately for me they have decided to treat me with Letrozole to reduce the lump prior to surgery.  This is a great outcome as I can hopefully avoid all Chemo.  My problem is that I had to immediately come off HTR, which I had been on for 10 years and start Letrozole.  Over the past 4 months I have had to get used to night sweats and sleepless nights.  What I am having trouble coping with are the aching joints and feeling like 90 years old as I try to climb the stairs ( I am 60 and live up in a first and second floor appartment with only stairs) Every part of my body seems to ache.  I have for the past few years tried to walk 4 miles 3 times a week, but now it feels like I am dragging myself around the park.  Any ideas for supplements or techniques that have helped you that I can try. When I mentioned my symptoms to my nurse she did tell me that by taking me off HRT and putting me on Letrazole they had aged me 20 years!!!!  I just need some ideas to help me keep moving easily. Looking forward to hearing from you
